Lesson1.Hint: You want to Print the Working Directory to continue.
Lesson1.Error: Seems like you didn't type 'pwd'.  Try again.
Lesson1.Title: Print Working Directory
Lesson1.Question: Print out the current working directory.
Lesson1.Instructions: pwd (print working directory): This command will return the path of the directory you are currently in.

Lesson2.Hint: You need to Change the Directory to 'california' continue.
Lesson2.Error: Seems like you didn't type 'cd california'.  Try again.
Lesson2.Title: Change Directory
Lesson2.Question: Please type 'cd USA' to change directories.
Lesson2.Instructions: cd (change directory): This command accepts arguments in the form of file structure in order to traverse the system.  For example: '$cd california' will change your working directory to $/usa/california'.

Lesson3.Error: Seems like you didn't type 'cd ..'.  Try again.
Lesson3.Title: Change Directory
Lesson3.Question: Please type 'cd ..' to return to $/usa/
Lesson3.Instructions: cd (change directory): This command accepts arguments in the form of file structure in order to traverse the system.  For example: '$cd bob' will change your working directory to $/usa/california'.

Lesson4.Error: Seems like you didn't type 'cd /california/san_francisco'.  Try again.
Lesson4.Title: Change Directory
Lesson4.Question: Change directories to /california/san_francisco'.
Lesson4.Instructions: cd (change directory): This command accepts arguments in the form of file structure in order to traverse the system.  For example: '$cd bob' will change your working directory to $/usa/california'.

Lesson5.Error: Seems like you didn't type 'ls'.  Try again.
Lesson5.Title: List Directory / Files
Lesson5.Question: Please type 'ls' to display contents.
Lesson5.Instructions: ls (list directory / files): This command will display the contents of a directory.  For example: 'ls' will display two sub folders below.

Lesson6.Hint: Please make a directory Ohio to continue.
Lesson6.Error: Seems like you didn't create a directory  called Ohio!
Lesson6.Title: Make Directory
Lesson6.Question: Make a new directory called Ohio
Lesson6.Instructions: Creating directories is an integral part of using Bash. A directory is a folder on your computer that contains other folders and files. To create a new directory we use the 'mkdir' command followed by the directory name

Lesson7.Hint: Please delete the directory BustinBash to continue.
Lesson7.Error: Seems like you didn't delete the directory correctly.  Try again.
Lesson7.Title: Remove Directory
Lesson7.Question: Make delete the directory called BustinBash
Lesson7.Instructions: Next we will learn how to delete a directory using the command line. Just type mkdir BustinBash to create your directory.
